questions.question_text:
A website is unexpectedly allowed due to miscategorization.

What are two ways to resolve this issue for a proper response? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: A B is correct
A & B is my answer

Selected Answer: AB
My vote

Selected Answer: AB
Correct
Voting for AB! Setting policy action to deny in option D renders the point moot of using URL filtering profiles!! The FW will simply disallow traffic flow entirely!!!

comments.content: On checking out details for option D, I also realized that it will never be enforced because the rule above it will be used instead!!!!

discussion.content:
Must be AB. 
D is below, so the action will be allowed.

Selected Answer: AB
AB is correct

Selected Answer: AB
It cannot be D as the suggested block policy is inserted 'below' the original policy and the original policy is allowing the traffic to the URL!

choices.C:
Identify the URL category being assigned to the website.
Edit the active URL Filtering profile and update that category's site access settings to block.
choices.A:
Create a URL category and assign the affected URL.
Update the active URL Filtering profile site access setting for the custom URL category to block.
choices.B:
Review the categorization of the website on https://urlfiltering paloaltonetworks.com.
Submit for "request change", identifying the appropriate categorization, and wait for confirmation before testing again.
choices.D:
Create a URL category and assign the affected URL.
Add a Security policy with a URL category qualifier of the custom URL category below the original policy.
Set the policy action to Deny.

questions.question_text:
Identify the correct order to configure the PAN-OS integrated USER-ID agent.
3. add the service account to monitor the server(s)
2. define the address of the servers to be monitored on the firewall
4. commit the configuration, and verify agent connection status
1. create a service account on the Domain Controller with sufficient permissions to execute the User- ID agent

discussion.content:
1-3-2-4

From the existing option 1-3-2-4 is correct. 1-2-3-4 would be correct as well, as there is no difference what you do first, add servers to be monitored, or define a useraccount
correct order in this case is: 1 2 3 4

comments.content: I guess the correct order is 1324, becuase first you create the account, then you add the, account in the firewall, then you add the servers you want to monitor and finally you apply the changes.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
It is 1,2,3 and ,4 you add the address of the servers to be managed before adding the account to the firewall . Correct answer not included

Read PCNSA:
https://beacon.paloaltonetworks.com/uploads/resource_courses/targets/4305199/original/index.html?_courseId=647605#/page/5f455be4ab83dd7f0319a464

Selected Answer: D
since you are working on two different devices here creation of the account on the domain controller can be done before or after the FW config commit, but I would go with 1324
The correct answer is 1-2-3-4. There isn't here.

questions.question_text: If the firewall interface E1/1 is connected to a SPAN or mirror port, which interface type should E1/1 be configured as?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct.
(https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/9-1/pan-os-admin/networking/configure-interfaces/tap-interfaces)

questions.question_text:
An administrator manages a network with 300 addresses that require translation. The administrator configured NAT with an address pool of 240 addresses and found that connections from addresses that needed new translations were being dropped.

Which type of NAT was configured?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The size of the NAT pool
should be equal to the number of internal hosts that require address translations. By default,
if the source address pool is larger than the NAT address pool and eventually all of the NAT
addresses are allocated, new connections that need address translation are dropped. To
override this default behavior, use Advanced (Dynamic IP/Port Fallback) to enable the use
of DIPP addresses when necessary

A is correct,
Question is 'Which type of NAT WAS configured?', not 'Which type of NAT SHOULD BE configured?'

Selected Answer: A
A. Dynamic IP

A. Dynamic IP

In a Dynamic IP NAT configuration, a pool of public IP addresses is assigned to incoming connections from a range of internal IP addresses1. If the number of internal addresses exceeds the number of addresses in the pool (as in this case, where there are 300 internal addresses but only 240 in the pool), new connections that require translation will be dropped

Selected Answer: A
DIPP is used for what is called "PAT"

Selected Answer: A
Dynamic IPâ€”Translates to the next available address in the specified range but the port number remains unchanged.

Selected Answer: A
Correct

Selected Answer: A
Asking about the NAT type used and not what should be used. Answer is A Dynamic IP
The answer should be A.

questions.question_text:
The NetSec Manager asked to create a new EMEA Regional Panorama Administrator profile with customized privileges. In particular, the new EMEA Regional Panorama Administrator should be able to:

Access only EMEA-Regional device groups with read-only privileges
Access only EMEA-Regional templates with read-only privileges

What is the correct configuration for the new EMEA Regional Panorama Administrator profile?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Administrator Type
- Dynamic - Roles that provide access to Panorama and managed firewalls.
- Custom Panorama Admin - Configurable roles that have read-write access, read-only
access, or no access to Panorama features.
- Device Group and Template Admin - Configurable roles that have read-write access,
read-only access, or no access to features for the device groups and templates that
are assigned to the access domains select for this administrator.

Selected Answer: A
Would say it's correct

choices.A:
Administrator Type = Device Group and Template Admin
Admin Role = EMEA_Regional_Admin_read_only
Access Domain = EMEA-Regional
choices.B:
Administrator Type = Dynamic -
Admin Role = Superuser (read-only)
choices.D:
Administrator Type = Custom Panorama Admin
Profile = EMEA Regional Admin_read_only
choices.C:
Administrator Type = Dynamic -
Admin Role = Panorama Administrator
